p: The PL pro and M pro enzymes of SARS-CoV-2 are also targets for peptide-based inhibitors. Through the use of a combinatorial library, one group has developed peptide inhibitors against M pro and PL pro [ 180, 179]. Substrates for both proteases were identified using a library that contained proteogenic and non-proteogenic amino acids. The best substrate candidates were then converted into peptide inhibitors through the addition of irreversible reactive group at the C-terminus, resulting in M pro inhibitor QS1 (Ac-Abu-Tle-Leu-Gln-VS), and PL pro inhibitors VIR251 and VIR250 (Ac-hTyr-Dap-Gly-Gly-VME and Ac-Abu(Bth)-Dap-Gly-Gly-VME, respectively). Kinetic analysis of these peptides against the SARS- CoV-2 M pro and PL pro indicated inhibition.
